result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deangelo Deon Hawthorne

records.addlTxt:
11:01 AM Defendant Deangelo Deon Hawthorne in court.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jaramy J Hansen in court for Deangelo Deon Hawthorne. 
Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
3:23 PM Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Deangelo Deon Hawthorne in court. Court questions status on the attorney. Defendant has not yet applied with the public defender. Court questions why the defendant has not yet applied with the public defender. Defendant indicates he would still like to attempt to retain counsel. Defendant will waive time limits of preliminary hearing to attempt to obtain counsel, asks for date 2-3 weeks out. Court removes preliminary hearing from the calendar and resets the hearing. Court indicates the hearing will not be reset again if he does not have counsel at next hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. No use or possession of a dangerous weapons to include firearms and ammunition. No contact with T.L. and N.J.

3:16 PM Defendant Deangelo Deon Hawthorne appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michael Hoffman making special appearance. Defendant updates Court of current address.  Attorney Hoffman waives reading and pleads not guilty to Count 2 and requests preliminary hearing on Count 1. State requests $1,000 cash bail and conditions of No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. No use or possession of a dangerous weapons to include firearms and ammunition. No contact with T.L. and N.J. State notes defendant has no priors. Defendant has no ties to Douglas County. Attorney Hoffman notes 10-15 years resident of St. Louis County and has family local. Believes could post up to $1,000 asks for $500. Court orders $500 cash bail and $3,000 signature bond with conditions of No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. No use or possession of a dangerous weapons to include firearms and ammunition. No contact with T.L. and N.J.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
